venue.name: Mt. Monadnock: Old Halfway House Trailhead

item.description:
Looking for something to do this weekend? Then you might have found it… that is should you want to spend a morning climbing up a 3,165’ mountain that is exactly 1 hr and 53 mins from downtown Providence, and an afternoon hiking down it, all in a span of a 6+ hour adventure on one of the most prolific small mountains in New England, capped off by what is sure to be the topic of your party conversations for weeks to come, a visit to Harlow’s Pub, the perfect compliment to a day on a mountain, where choosing good food + drink among good friends may very well be the best part of the day. Also, this is where we can celebrate the fact that we didn't end up in Vermont (you'll understand in a minute).

The Hike:

We’ll start by meeting at Monadnock State Park’s Old Toll Road entrance off of Rt 124 (map), and head up... by who knows, one of the trails leading to the top. On the way up, we’ll continue until we reach… lets say, the Fairy Springs Trail… or how ‘bout Mossy Brook, via the Cart Path??? We’ll then bear left, or right, or continue straight-ahead until… until, I don’t know… until we cross Monte Rosa, or pass Billings Wall. Do we have a vote for Bald Rock??? Ok!!! For arguments sake, we’ll hike to the Black Precipice [A place which I am sure by the sound of things so far, you’re imagining that's exactly where I’m gonna be leading you.] From the precipice, we’ll pull ourselves back and continue to the summit, by whichever way is shortest, or longest, or somewhere's in-between. From the summit, after we’ve lunched and had our fill of 360 degree views, we’ll start heading down, by way of... you guessed it!!! one of the trails leading to the bottom. Which every way we go, whatever turns we take, plan on experiencing beautiful spruce and maple forests, moss lined trails, cliff-side views, pine duff carpeting, and a view or two to write home about.

Note: Although it is summer, be prepared for changes in temperature and strong winds on the summit. Have layers available, bring plenty of water and food. We will be hiking a mountain that will require some rock scrambling, which includes some very steep climbs and some not-so-very-steep climbs, so having a very good idea of your abilities and limits is necessary. Also, pets are not permitted (park rules).

EQUIPMENT CHECKLIST

Summer Essentials (required):
• Synthetic Quick-drying Pants or Shorts
• Synthetic Quick-drying Shirt
• Sturdy Hiking Boots/shoes
• Synthetic/Wool Socks
• Sunscreen/Sunglasses/Bug Repellant
• Extra pair of Socks
• Rain Shell
• Water (3+L)
• Headlamp/Flashlight
• Map/Compass/Whistle
• Lunch
• Snack/Energy Food (extra food)


the Remaining Essentials:
• Medications/First Aid Supplies
• Emergency Blanket (so small & light, there's hardly a reason not to have one in your pack)
• Fire (waterproof matches, lighter, starter)
• Repair Kit/Knife
• Insulated/Fleece Jacket
• Extra Layers

Optional:
• Light-weight Wind Jacket (if you are w/o a rain jacket)
• Trekking Poles
• Light-weight Emergency Shelter
• Camera/Binoculars

Important:
NO JEANS, NO SNEAKERS, NO COTTON CLOTHING



Directions:
Find your way to Jaffrey, NH. Follow Rt 124 west past Dublin Rd. (& the main entrance to Monadnock St Park), continue for approx. 3 miles (5 min) until you reach the Old Toll Rd/Halfway House park entrance. Turn right. Pay. Park. Hike. (Park Entrance Fee: $4 per person)

From Providence: 2 hours
From Newport: 2 hours 30 minutes

Google Maps:
http://maps.google.com/maps?...

(Lat.=42.83529, Lon.=-72.113844)


Additional Information:

Mount Monadnock: 3165 feet

Distance: approx. 6+ miles
Elevation Gain (total): approx. 1800 ft
Exposure: Full @ the summit

Difficulty: Moderate/Strenuous
Pace: Slow/Moderate
Approx. Hike Time (including stops): 6:00+ hrs

10-Day Weather Outlook:
http://www.weather.com/weather/tenday/USNH0116



Liability Waiver:
As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: From Jaffrey, follow Rt 124 west for approx. 5 miles (pass Dublin Rd, the park's main entrance), turn right @ the Old Toll Road park entrance; call if you can't find us. Cell: 860-460-1500
item.name: Last Minute Monadnock
